response:

1. Alice wants $6000 (60%) and offers me $4000 (40%)
2. She's right that she faces 10% inflation per round while I don't
3. If I reject, I can make a counter-offer next round
4. Her $6000 would be worth only $5400 to her next round (10% less)
5. This gives me negotiating leverage in the next round
6. Since I don't face inflation, I can afford to wait and potentially get a better deal

Given these factors, I'll reject this offer. I can propose a more favorable split next round, and Alice will be more likely to accept due to her inflation pressure.
